intro: Lappula hendersonii, commonly known as Henderson's lappula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Lappula hendersonii is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
